SENTENCE.STRING: (Serbian Cyrillic: Гаврило Принцип) (pronounced (gäv´ri:lo: pri:n´tsip) (July 25, 1894 - April 28, 1918) was a Serb member of the Young Bosnia secret society
assassinated Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie, Duchess of Hohenberg in Sarajevo on June 28, 1914.
The event, known as the assassination in Sarajevo, prompted the Austrian action against Serbia that led to World War I.
